DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCMNeilFreund: Hey, an outsider with a Vault suit. There's something you don't see everyday.
RESPONSE TEXT: Don't say anything, but man, I'd love to be out there.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You should check it out. It's got a lot of offer these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Hope you guys get some breaks at least. You can't work all the time.
RESPONSE TEXT: Tell me about it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: They say it's all the moving parts that have us working 'round the clock these days.
SCRIPT NOTES: Knows the truth all too well. / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Screw work, do you what you want.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wish.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: They say it's all the moving parts that have us working 'round the clock these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Hard work pays off, and you guys are maintaining the Vault, right?
RESPONSE TEXT: Trying to at least.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: They say it's all the moving parts that have us working 'round the clock these days.
SCRIPT NOTES: Hopes their work is worth it. / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Why the long hours?
RESPONSE TEXT: We're just making sure this roof over our heads doesn't cave in on us.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: They say it's all the moving parts that have us working 'round the clock these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You should check it out. It's got a lot of offer these days.
RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe someday. At the rate we're working these days, maybe sooner than later.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Hope you guys get some breaks at least. You can't work all the time.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's pretty dangerous. You wouldn't last a day.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah, that's the fear. Least with the way the Overseer has us working, 81 will still be around for a while.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Hope you guys get some breaks at least. You can't work all the time.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It takes some preparation. I'd learn how to use a gun and be ready to use it before I went out there.
RESPONSE TEXT: I've never even touched a gun. I can even say if our Security has seen any real combat.
But with the hours we're working these days, I'm not even sure where I'd find time to practice.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Hope you guys get some breaks at least. You can't work all the time.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: If you want to leave, why don't you just go?
RESPONSE TEXT: Wish it was that easy. It's scary, leaving the Vault. And the Commonwealth? It's all so... unpredictable.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You should check it out. It's got a lot of offer these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Tell me about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: They say it's all the moving parts that have us working 'round the clock these days.
Structurally, I guess 81 is still pretty sound. Vault-Tec sure knew what they were doing when they set these places up.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: Well, I don't want to keep you, and I gotta get back to work. Maybe I'll see you around.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Neil: Structurally, I guess 81 is still pretty sound. Vault-Tec sure knew what they were doing when they set these places up.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, I don't want to keep you, and I gotta get back to work. Maybe I'll see you around.
Hey, an outsider with a Vault suit. There's something you don't see everyday.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: Don't say anything, but man, I'd love to be out there.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, surprised the player is wearing a Vault suit. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: Power Armor? There's something you don't see everyday.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: Don't say anything, but man, I'd love to be out there.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, surprised the player is wearing Power Armor. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: So we got a new visitor today.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Neil: Don't say anything, but man, I'd love to be out there.

RESPONSE TEXT: Someday I'll make it out there.
I heard Diamond City is pretty nice, tucked behind some walls. Sounds safe enough.
If only the Commonwealth wasn't so dangerous. I'd love to see more of it.
Miranda likes to tell me that I'm just taking 81 for granted, but I can't help but feel trapped here sometimes.
Calvin told me I just want out so I can slack off. Maybe he's right. This work is just killing me.
I hope you know, that's no small thing you did back there, saving Austin.
Austin was just a kid. I'm beginning to see why Miranda hates outsiders so much.
SCRIPT NOTES: Upset with player for saving himself instead of a child. / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I'm not usually wrong about people, but damn, letting a child die? Maybe the Commonwealth isn't for me.
SCRIPT NOTES: Disgusted that the player chose to let a child die. / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: If the Commonwealth is filled with people like you, I want no part of it.
SCRIPT NOTES: Disgusted the player let a child die. / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: You outsiders sure are cold.
SCRIPT NOTES: Disgusted the player let a child die. / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: What kind of person lets a child die?
SCRIPT NOTES: Disgusted with the player for letting a child die. / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: Did I say something wrong?
SCRIPT NOTES: Doesn't want to offend. Player isn't responding. / Nervous

RESPONSE TEXT: You were saying?
SCRIPT NOTES: Doesn't want to offend. Player isn't responding. / Nervous

RESPONSE TEXT: Take your time. I'm not going anywhere.
SCRIPT NOTES: Doesn't want to offend. Player isn't responding. / Nervous

DIALOGUE BEFORE: CitizenFemale: How's your head feeling today?
RESPONSE TEXT: Still a little pounding, but getting better.
Nothing I can't handle.
DIALOGUE AFTER: CitizenFemale: Nice to know it wasn't another migraine kicking in.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: CitizenFemale: Nice to know it wasn't another migraine kicking in.
RESPONSE TEXT: Tell me about it. Cal, would bust my ass if I called out again, too.
SCRIPT NOTES: Glad he didn't miss work. / Grateful

RESPONSE TEXT: How's it looking?
DIALOGUE AFTER: CitizenFemale: Eh, same old, same old.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: CitizenFemale: Another day, another double shift.
RESPONSE TEXT: I hear ya. Maybe you could see about working in Doctor Penske's lab again?
DIALOGUE AFTER: CitizenFemale: Yeah, maybe, but no way I'm sampling anymore of her creations.
